title: Art Deco Olympic Games Berlin 1936 poster type
author: garden

comments.content:
Probably hand drawn. We might find something similar.

- Lex

P.S. I love the posters from the Berlin olympics. There's also that other one with the horse and that delicious geometric sans face.

probably. anything similar :D. does it resembles to something?

p.s never saw that with horse...
Finding a splayed M might be the clincher. I wonder if Red Rooster doesn't have something similar.
If i could find something bigger :D to recreate it :)

Rudolf Koch's Marathon is very similar.

Here's Ute Harder's revival:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/marathon-lt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902231405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/marathon-lt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/marathon-lt/")

David Thometz

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902231405im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1936poster2_5229.jpg)

This is the one I was talking about. It's hand-lettered too I think.

- Lex

The first poster's lettering reminds me of Schneidler Initials, the basis of Jason Castle's [Shango](http://web.archive.org/web/20140902231405/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/shango/).

The others with the sans lettering remind me of Optima, which I know was designed later, or one of Koch's lineales from the 30's, like Offenbach (see Jaspert for a sample).

- Mike Yanega
